etymologies: early 17th century: from modern Latin syncretismus, from Greek sunkrētismos, from sunkrētizein ‘unite against a third party’, from sun- ‘together’ + krēs ‘Cretan’ (originally with reference to ancient Cretan communities)

definitions: the amalgamation or attempted amalgamation of different religions, cultures, or schools of thought

examples.text: interfaith dialogue can easily slip into syncretism

shortDefinitions: amalgamation or attempted amalgamation of different religions

definitions: the merging of different inflectional varieties of a word during the development of a language.
shortDefinitions: merging of different inflectional varieties of word during development of language
